article.description: Texas A&M Corpus Christi 85, Sam Houston State 68
article.headline: Texas A&M Corpus Christi 85, Sam Houston State 68
article.linkText: Texas A&M Corpus Christi 85, Sam Houston State 68
article.story: HUNTSVILLE, Texas (AP) -- Chris Daniels scored 20 points as Texas A&M-Corpus Christi captured the Southland Conference regular-season title by beating Sam Houston State 85-68 Saturday. Kevin Menifee added 18 points and Taurean Mitchell had 13 for the Islanders, who became a conference member this season after the program spent its first seven playing as an independent. Sam Houston State's Aaron Wade had 18 points. With the win, the Islanders (23-6, 14-2 Southland Conference) avenged an 84-79 loss to Sam Houston State (21-9, 13-3) earlier this season. The Islanders broke the game open late in the first half with a 15-5 run that gave them a 44-40 halftime lead. Daniels was 10-of-13 from the field for Texas A&M-Corpus Christi, which shot 60 percent from the floor.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
